The Agriculture price index comprises three sub-indices: Beverages (12.9 percent), Food (61.7 percent), and Raw Materials (25.4 percent).
Aluminum (LME) London Metal Exchange, unalloyed primary ingots, high grade, minimum 99.7 percent purity, settlement price beginning 2005; previously cash price.
Bananas (Central & South America), major brands, free on truck (f.o.t.) Southern Europe, including duties; prior to October 2006, f.o.t. Hamburg.
Bananas (Central & South America), major brands, US import price, free on truck (f.o.t.) US Gulf ports.

Barley (US) feed, No. 2, spot, 20 days To-Arrive, delivered Minneapolis from May 2012 onwards; during 1980 - 2012 April Canadian, feed, Western No. 1, Winnipeg Commodity Exchange, spot, wholesale farmers' price.

The Base Metals price index comprises six commodities: Aluminum (32.9 percent), Copper (47.4 percent), Lead (2.2 percent), Nickel (9.9 percent), Tin (2.6 percent), and Zinc (5.0 percent). It is a subset of the Metals and Minerals price index, which includes the same six commodities plus iron ore.
Beef (Australia/New Zealand), mixed trimmings 85 percent, East Coast, 7-45 day deferred delivery, free on board (f.o.b.) port of entry, beginning January 1995; previously cow forequarters.
The Beverages price index comprises three commodities: Coffee (45.7 percent), Cocoa (36.9 percent), and Tea (17.4 percent).

Chicken (US), Urner Barry North East weighted average for broiler/fryer, whole birds, 2.5 to 3.5 pounds, US Department of Agriculture (USDA) grade 'A' from 2013 onwards; 1980-2012, Georgia Dock weighted average, 2.5 to 3 pounds, wholesale; previously World Bank estimates.

Coal (Australia), from February 2022, port thermal, free on board (f.o.b.) Newcastle, 6000 kcal/kg futures price. From 2015 to January 2022, port thermal, f.o.b. Newcastle, 6000 kcal/kg spot price. 2002-2014, thermal GAR, f.o.b. piers, Newcastle/Port Kembla , 6,300 kcal/kg (11,340 btu/lb), less than 0.8 percent, sulfur 13 percent ash; previously 6,667 kcal/kg (12,000 btu/lb), less than 1.0 percent sulfur, 14 percent ash.

Coal (South Africa), from January 2015, free on board (f.o.b.) Richards Bay, net as received (NAR), 6,000 kcal/kg, sulfur less than 1 percent, forward month 1; from February 13, 2017 to December 2017, thermal NAR netback assessment f.o.b. Richards Bay 6,000 kcal/kg; during 2006-February 10, 2017 thermal NAR; during 2002-2005 6,200 kcal/kg (11,200 btu/lb), less than 1.0 percent, sulfur 16 percent ash; years 1990-2001 6390 kcal/kg (11,500 btu/lb).
Cocoa (ICCO), International Cocoa Organization daily price, average of the first three positions on the terminal markets of New York and London, nearest three future trading months.

Coconut oil (Philippines/Indonesia), from January 2021, crude, cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.) Rotterdam; January 1999 to December 2020, crude, c.i.f. NW Europe; previously, bulk, c.i.f. Rotterdam.
Coffee (ICO), International Coffee Organization indicator price, other mild Arabicas, average New York and Bremen/Hamburg markets, ex-dock.
Coffee (ICO), International Coffee Organization indicator price, Robustas, average New York and Le Havre/Marseilles markets, ex-dock.
Copper (LME), grade A, minimum 99.9935 percent purity, cathodes and wire bar shapes, settlement price.
Cotton (Cotton Outlook 'CotlookA index'), middling 1-3/32 inch, traded in Far East, C/F beginning 2006; previously Northern Europe, cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.).
Crude oil, UK Brent 38` API.
Crude oil, Dubai Fateh 32` API for years 1985-present; 1960-84 refer to Saudi Arabian Light, 34` API.
Crude oil, US, West Texas Intermediate (WTI) 40` API.
Crude oil, average spot price of Brent, Dubai and West Texas Intermediate, equally weighed.
DAP (diammonium phosphate), spot, free on board (f.o.b.) US Gulf.
The Energy price index comprises three commodities: Coal (4.7 percent), Crude Oil (84.6 percent), and Natural Gas (10.8 percent).
The Fertilizers price index comprises four commodities: Natural Phosphate Rock (16.9 percent), Phosphate (21.7 percent), Potassium (20.1 percent), and Nitrogenous (41.3 percent).
Fishmeal, from January 2021, German Fishmeal, Danish 64 percent Pro, free on board (f.o.b.) Bremen; January 1999 to December 2020, German, 64 percent protein, Ex Works (EXW) Hamburg.
The Food price index comprises three sub-indices: Cereals/Grains (28.2 percent), Vegetable Oils and Meals (40.8 percent), and Other Food (31.0 percent).
Gold (UK), 99.5 percent fine, London afternoon fixing, average of daily rates.
The Grains (or Cereals) price index comprises four commodities: Rice (30.1 percent), Wheat (25.2 percent), Maize (40.7 percent), and Barley (4.1 percent).

Groundnut oil, Dutch Refined GroundNut Oil any origin (A/O), Ex Tank Rotterdam, beginning December 2020; January 1999-November 2020, US crude, free on board (f.o.b.) South-East; previously any origin, cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.) Rotterdam.
Groundnuts (US), Runners 40/50, cost and freight (cfr) N.W. Europe. Europe beginning January 1999; previously (US), Runners 40/50 shelled basis, cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.). Rotterdam.

Iron ore, spot in US dollar/dry ton and contract in US cents/dmtu. For years 2008 (December) to present, spot, (any origin) fines, 62 percent Fe, c.f.r. China; during 2006 to 2008 (November) spot, 63.5 percent Fe. Earlier data refer to annual contract prices (Brazil for Europe,) VALE Carajas mines sinter feed, free on board (f.o.b.) Ponta da Madeira during years 1987-2009; Itabira mines f.o.b. Tubarao for years 1960-86. Unit dmtu denotes dry metric ton unit , i.e. 1 percent Fe-unit.

Lamb (US), boxed lamb cuts, leg, double, trotter-on, less than truckload (LTL) pricing, from August 2010; previously, (New Zealand) frozen whole carcasses Prime Medium (PM) wholesale, Smithfield, London beginning January 2006; previously Prime Light (PL).
Lead (LME), refined, 99.97 percent purity, settlement price.
Liquefied natural gas (Japan), LNG, import price, cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.); recent two months' averages are estimates.
Logs (Africa), sapele, high quality (loyal and marchand), 80 centimeter or more, free on board (f.o.b.) Douala, Cameroon beginning January 1996; previously of unspecified dimension.
Logs (Southeast Asia), meranti, Sarawak, sale price charged by importers, Tokyo beginning February 1993; previously average of Sabah and Sarawak weighted by Japanese import volumes.
Maize (US), no. 2, yellow, free on board (f.o.b.) US Gulf ports.

The Metals and Minerals price index comprises seven commodities: Aluminum (26.7 percent), Copper (38.4 percent), Iron Ore (18.9 percent), Lead (1.8 percent), Nickel (8.1 percent), Tin (2.1 percent), and Zinc (4.1 percent).
Natural gas index (Laspeyres), average of Europe, US and Japan (LNG), weights based on 5-year average consumption volumes, updated every 5 years, except the 11-year period 1960-70.

Natural Gas (Europe), from April 2015, Netherlands Title Transfer Facility (TTF); April 2010 to March 2015, average import border price and a spot price component, including UK; during June 2000 - March 2010 prices excludes UK.
Natural Gas (US), spot price at Henry Hub, Louisiana.
Nickel (LME), cathodes, minimum 99.8 percent purity, settlement price beginning 2005; previously cash price.
The Non-Energy price index comprises three sub-indices: Metals and Minerals (31.6 percent), Agriculture (64.9 percent), and Fertilizer (3.6 percent).

The Vegetable Oils and Meals price index comprises six commodities: Soybeans (24.6 percent), Soybean Oil (13.0 percent), Soybean Meal (26.3 percent), Palm Oil (30.2 percent), Coconut Oil (3.1 percent), and Groundnut Oil (2.8 percent).
Oranges (Mediterranean exporters) navel, European Union indicative import price, cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.). Paris.
The Other Food price index comprises five commodities: Sugar (31.5 percent), Bananas (15.7 percent), Beef (22.0 percent), Chicken (19.2 percent), and Oranges (11.6 percent).
The Other Raw Materials price index comprises three commodities: Cotton (24.7 percent), Natural Rubber (46.7 percent), and Tobacco (28.7 percent).

Palm kernel oil (Malaysia/Indonesia), from January 2021, crude cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.) Rotterdam; August 2001 to December 2020, crude, c.i.f. NW Europe; previously Malaysian, nearest forward.

Soybeans, from January 2021, U.S Gulf Yellow Soybean #2, cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.) Rotterdam; December 2007 to December 2020, US No. 2 yellow meal, c.i.f. Rotterdam; previously US origin, nearest forward.

The Timber price index comprises two commodities: Logs (22.1 percent) and Sawnwood (77.9 percent).

Tobacco (any origin), unmanufactured, general import, cost, insurance, and freight (c.i.f.), US.

Zinc (LME), high grade, minimum 99.95 percent purity, settlement price beginning April 1990; previously special high grade, minimum 99.995 percent, cash prices.

The World Bank does not provide a calculation of an overall or total index. It provides 3 topline indices: Energy, Non-energy, and Precious Metals; without any indication or calculation of the respective weight of these within the commodities market.
Coal is reported to make up 4.65% of the Energy Index. There are two Coal commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Coal index.
Rice is reported to make up 30.1% of the Cereals Index. There are four Rice commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 25% of the Rice index.
Wheat is reported to make up 25.2% of the Cereals Index. There are two Wheat commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Wheat index.
Maize is reported to make up 40.7% of the Cereals Index. There are two Maize commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Maize index.

Groundnuts are reported to make up 2.8% of the Oils and Fats Index. There are two Groundnut commodity prices quoted (groundnuts and groundnut oil); therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Groundnut index.
Sugar is reported to make up 31.5% of the Other Food Index. There are three Sugar commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 33.3% of the Sugar index.
Bananas are reported to make up 15.7% of the Other Food Index. There are two Banana commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Banana index.
Coffee is reported to make up 45.7% of the Beverage Index. There are two Coffee commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Coffee index.
Rubber is reported to make up 46.7% of the Other Raw Materials Index. There are two Rubber commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Rubber index.
Logs are reported to make up 22.1% of the Timber Index. There are two Logs commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Logs index.
Sawnwood is reported to make up 77.9% of the Timber Index. There are two Sawnwood commodity prices quoted; therefore it is assumed that each one makes up 50% of the Sawnwood index.

Other Food is reported to make up 30.22% of the Food Index; and consists of eight commodities, each with given weights within this index. However, there is no accompanying data calculating this index value.
